overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Pub/Sub.

First, install @google-cloud/pubsub with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/pubsub

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/pubsubâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')();

Elsewhere

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/pubsub are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: PublisherClient
methods.description:
The service that an application uses to manipulate topics, and to send messages to a topic.

This will be created through a builder function which can be obtained by the module. See the following example of how to initialize the module and how to access to the builder.

methods.name: projectPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromProjectName
methods.description: Parses the projectName from a project resource.

params.name: projectName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a project resources.

methods.name: topicPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified topic resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromTopicName
methods.description: Parses the topicName from a topic resource.

params.name: topicName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a topic resources.

methods.name: matchTopicFromTopicName
methods.description: Parses the topicName from a topic resource.

params.name: topicName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a topic resources.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

methods.name: createTopic
methods.description: Creates the given topic with the given name.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The name of the topic. It must have the format "projects/{project}/topics/{topic}". {topic} must start with a letter, and contain only letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9]), dashes (-), underscores (_), periods (.), tildes (~), plus (+) or percent signs (%). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in length, and it must not start with "goog".

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Topic Topic.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Topic Topic. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Adds one or more messages to the topic. Returns NOT_FOUND if the topic does not exist. The message payload must not be empty; it must contain either a non-empty data field, or at least one attribute.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.topic
params.description: The messages in the request will be published on this topic. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: request.messages
params.description:
The messages to publish.

This object should have the same structure as PubsubMessage PubsubMessage

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing PublishResponse PublishResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing PublishResponse PublishResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.topic
params.description: The name of the topic to get. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Topic Topic.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Topic Topic. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.project
params.description: The name of the cloud project that topics belong to. Format is projects/{project}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of Topic Topic.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListTopicsResponse ListTopicsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of Topic Topic.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of Topic Topic in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListTopicsResponse ListTopicsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listTopicsStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listTopics}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listTopics} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.project
params.description: The name of the cloud project that topics belong to. Format is projects/{project}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits an object representing Topic Topic on 'data' event.

methods.name: listTopicSubscriptions
methods.description: Lists the name of the subscriptions for this topic.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.topic
params.description: The name of the topic that subscriptions are attached to. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of string.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListTopicSubscriptionsResponse ListTopicSubscriptionsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of string.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of string in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListTopicSubscriptionsResponse ListTopicSubscriptionsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listTopicSubscriptionsStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listTopicSubscriptions}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listTopicSubscriptions} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.topic
params.description: The name of the topic that subscriptions are attached to. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits a string on 'data' event.

methods.name: deleteTopic
methods.description: Deletes the topic with the given name. Returns NOT_FOUND if the topic does not exist. After a topic is deleted, a new topic may be created with the same name; this is an entirely new topic with none of the old configuration or subscriptions. Existing subscriptions to this topic are not deleted, but their topic field is set to _deleted-topic_.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.topic
params.description: Name of the topic to delete. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: setIamPolicy
methods.description: Sets the access control policy on the specified resource. Replaces any existing policy.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being specified. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: request.policy
params.description:
REQUIRED: The complete policy to be applied to the resource. The size of the policy is limited to a few 10s of KB. An empty policy is a valid policy but certain Cloud Platform services (such as Projects) might reject them.

This object should have the same structure as Policy Policy

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Policy Policy.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Policy Policy. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: getIamPolicy
methods.description: Gets the access control policy for a resource. Returns an empty policy if the resource exists and does not have a policy set.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being requested. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Policy Policy.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Policy Policy. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: testIamPermissions
methods.description: Returns permissions that a caller has on the specified resource. If the resource does not exist, this will return an empty set of permissions, not a NOT_FOUND error.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy detail is being requested. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: request.permissions
params.description: The set of permissions to check for the resource. Permissions with wildcards (such as '' or 'storage.') are not allowed. For more information see IAM Overview.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing TestIamPermissionsResponse TestIamPermissionsResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing TestIamPermissionsResponse TestIamPermissionsResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: opts
params.description: • The optional parameters.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
